channel.title: Will the Black Mesa be a competitor to EP3?
channel.description:
Hi there!
I am new to this community, but I was following the mod updated and media since its first announce. It was so hard to understand that 2009 release is delayed for indefinite time.
I just wanted to ask developers about the possibility of competitiveness of BM and EP3. I think, if you release the BM right in an EP3 release day, everyone will start playing the BM first to re-visit the first HL world. Then everyone will replay HL2 with episodes 1-2, and only after that they will take Episode 3.
Valve didn't support you guys with your great remake, as they supported other projects like Portal 2 and Left4Dead. The method, described by me will really stack the Valve Corp.

item.description:
xalener:

And suddenly a car bursts into his room, launching him 40 feet into the air. While in flight, his dick shrivels and rots away leaving a new, fresh vagina that then opens wide to birth triplets.

Congratulations, you have had 3 girls at once while flying.

OMG. i had the exact same thing happen last week. :what:

item.title: Will the Black Mesa be a competitor to EP3?
item.dc:creator: Llewen_Ebag
item.description:
ive got 4 kids rounded up for the ep3 sacrifice
plz help with more

To me it would be extremely weird that, two different games, in both objective and pricing would compete. After all, people who actually are involved in this won’t be saying “hmm, two half lifes, which one?”, they’ll be saying “hmm, a new half life and a anticipated mod, cool”.

item.title: Will the Black Mesa be a competitor to EP3?
item.dc:creator: Dr_Karamazov
item.description:
No, BMS will never compete with EP3 because there is no such thing as EP3.

EP3 is a fairy tale told by parents to their kids on stormy nights.
“Be good little Johnny or else Gabe Newell will release EP3 and then come and eat you.”
